intro: Delpechia artensis, commonly known as the artensis delpechia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
